info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:22AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Carroll, eastern Jo Daviess and Stephenson Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 721 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Argyle to near Nora to near Massbach. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lena and Winslow around 725 AM CDT. Pearl City around 735 AM CDT. Shannon and Cedarville around 740 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Dakota, Freeport, Rock City, Davis, German Valley and Ridott. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
